title: 2,864 persons vaccinated against COVID-19
body_lines: First dose vaccination coverage in the country has risen to 77.62%, the Epidemiology Unit states, adding that 2,864 persons were vaccinated against COVID-19 on Monday.

Second dose coverage is 65.82% among the total population and third dose coverage is 36%. According to the Epidemiology Unit, 96.2% of the population over 20 years has received the second vaccine dose and 54% has received the third dose.
Vaccination coverage is 80.3% among the population between 16 and 19 years.
The first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine has been administered to 96.4% of the population over 12 years and 81.7% of this population has received the second vaccine dose as well.
According to the Epidemiology Unit, 17,013,894 persons have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine and 14,427,857 persons have received the second dose of a vaccine.
The booster dose has been administered to 7,892,726 persons. This includes 2,100 persons vaccinated on Monday.

On Monday, 230 persons received the first dose of Pfizer and 469 persons received the second dose of the vaccine. In total, 2,522,015 persons have received the first dose of Pfizer and 889,998 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine.

12 persons received the first dose of Sinopharm on Monday and a total of 12,048,337 persons have received the first dose of Sinopharm. The second dose has been administered to 11,176,093 persons. This includes 53 persons vaccinated on Monday.
The first dose of AstraZeneca has been administered to 1,479,631 persons and 1,418,593 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine.
A total of 804,801 persons have received the first dose of Moderna and 787,361 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine.
The first dose of Sputnik V has been administered to 159,110 persons and the second dose has been administered to 155,812 persons.
